meanings.definition: To turn or move in a circle around a central point.
meanings.sent1: The merry-go-round rotated slowly, making the children giggle.
meanings.sent2: She carefully rotated the key in the lock until she heard a click.
meanings.sent3: The pizza rotated in the oven, getting evenly cooked on all sides.
meanings.sent4: Time rotated like a wheel, bringing back the same seasons each year.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beam rotated, guiding ships safely through the night.

meanings.definition: To change the position of something by turning it around a central point.
meanings.sent1: He rotated the vase to display its intricate design from all angles.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic rotated the tires on the car to ensure even wear.
meanings.sent3: The cat rotated its head curiously, trying to understand the strange noise.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts rotated in her mind, considering different perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The Earth rotates on its axis, causing day and night.

meanings.definition: To alternate or change in sequence.
meanings.sent1: The students rotated taking turns to lead the class discussion.
meanings.sent2: The crops rotated each season to maintain soil fertility.
meanings.sent3: The colors on the screen rotated, creating a mesmerizing visual effect.
meanings.sent4: Her moods rotated between excitement and nervousness as the event approached.
meanings.sent5: The flavors in the dish rotated, surprising the taste buds with each bite.
